name: Nobody Left Outside Platform
goal: The Nobody Left Outside Platform is a collective of dynamic organisations representing some of Europe's most marginlized and underserved groups, including LGTBI, sex workers, migrants, homeless, people who inject drugs (PWID), and prisoners. United under the banner ‘Nobody Left Outside’, we are working together to identify common challenges, share lessons learned through years of community engagement, and seek integrated solutions to improve access to healthcare for the communities of people we represent. The NLO members represent and support underserved communities in nearly all 53 WHO European Region countries, both directly and through their national members spread across the region. As a start, the NLO initiative is working at European level, with the aim to disseminate guidance and practical tools to members in all countries, particularly central Europe and East Asia.
interests: Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
European Pillar of Social Rights
European Social Fund Plus
EU Action on Health Inequalities
EU Action on AIDS, Hepatitis and TB
EU Action on Migration
Health Service Performance Assessment
